result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence E Horsch Jr

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  State moves to dismiss and read in along with a plea to Ct. 2 in 15-CM-153 and 15-CM-483 and Court so orders.
Per request of Atty. Michael Kenitz, resolution anticipated in Br. 3 with 15CF153 and case scheduled for global resolution in Br. 3 on 8-19-15 at 8:15 a.m.

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CM483 Br. 1, 15CM153 Br. 3)  Counsel request adjournment for global offer to be considered and resolved in Br. 3.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Counsel received additional discovery materials, waiting for additional information.  Anticipates global resolution.  Hearing scheduled for August 5th, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Atty Mike Kenitz appearing for Def.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.   Clerk: EZ.  (15CM483 Br. 1, 15CM153 Br. 3)  Adjourned for discovery and pretrial.  Court does not permit authorization for next court date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription; Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety

Defendant has pending cases in Br. 1 (15CM483) & Br. 3 (15CM153) SPD appointed Atty Kenitz for those cases and anticipates that Atty Kenitz will also be appointed on this case as well;  Statements from defendant.  State requests cash bond; Argument from counsel;  Court sets $   Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. e3:52  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
